page.title: 08In our Freetime
page.content: In their free time Class 6 children do swimming, rollerskating, football, and play in the woods and streets. Some people play on their computers. Paul Luckett's favouite computer game is Jasper. In Jasper you are a little mouse and you must find your way around the screens and try to open the doors of the house by getting a key. Other people watch television or play on their bikes or do jobs for their mums and dads. Some people draw and colour. Some play swingball and games in the garden. Swingball is an outdoor game. It has a pole and a tennis ball attached to a piece of string which is attached to the pole. If there are two playing one stands either side of the pole and hits the ball with a racket. Helen Barnard plays on her organ.{
